CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. active layer: This term generally refers to the layer in an organic electronics device where the active charge generation and transport occurs. In this context, it likely refers to the layer containing the polymers P1-P7 and PC71BM or PC61BM.
4. LiF: Lithium Fluoride
5. Al: Aluminum
6. P1-P7: Unnamed polymers used as electron donors.
7. PC71BM (or PC61BM): Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) or Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) respectively. These are polymers used as electron acceptors.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. LiF: Lithium Fluoride
4. Al: Aluminum
5. P1-P7: Unnamed polymers
6. PC71BM (or PC61BM): Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) or Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) respectively.

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Indium Tin Oxide (ITO) |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEDOT : PSS) |
| Lithium Fluoride (LiF) |
| Aluminum (Al) |
| Unnamed polymers P1-P7 |
| Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) (PC71BM) |
| Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-2,2'-bithiophene) (PC61BM) |

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate)
3. active layer
4. LiF: Lithium Fluoride
5. Al: Aluminum
6. P1-P7: Polymers 1 through 7
7. PC71BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid) or Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,2-thiophene-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid)
8. PC61BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid) or Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,2-thiophene-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid)

These entities are identified as "Property Name" as they represent specific materials or components used in the fabrication of the PSCs (Polymer Solar Cells).
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide (conductive material)
2. PEDOT : PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (conjugated polymer)
3. LiF: Lithium Fluoride (inorganic material)
4. active layer (material layer)
5. PC71BM, PC61BM: Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid or Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,2-thiophene-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid) (conjugated polymers, electron acceptors)

These entities are identified as "Material Property" as they represent specific materials used in the fabrication of the PSCs.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| Indium Tin Oxide (ITO) |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene):poly(styrenesulfonate) (PEDOT : PSS) |
| Lithium Fluoride (LiF) |
| active layer |
| Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,5'-(2,2'-bithiophene)-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid (PC71BM) |
| Poly(3-hexylthiophene-2,5-diyl-alt-5,2-thiophene-3-thiophenecarboxylic acid (PC61BM) |

These entities are presented precisely as they appear in the original paragraph and are identified as "Material Property" as they represent specific materials used in the fabrication of the PSCs.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: The PSCs were fabricated with a structure of ITO / PEDOT : PSS / active layer / LiF / Al , where the polymers ( P1- P7 ) were used as electron donors and PC71BM ( or PC61BM ) was used as an electron acceptor.

Let's think step by step.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide - a conductive material used as a transparent electrode in the PSCs (Perovskite Solar Cells).
2. PEDOT: PSS: Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate) - a conducting polymer used as a hole transport material in the PSCs.
3. active layer: The layer in the PSCs where the perovskite material is deposited and where the charge separation and transport occurs.
4. LiF: Lithium Fluoride - a compound used as a buffer layer in the PSCs to improve the contact between the perovskite layer and the aluminum electrode.
5. Al: Aluminum - a metal used as a back contact in the PSCs.
6. P1-P7: Unspecified polymers used as electron donors in the PSCs.
7. PC71BM (or PC61BM): Poly[2-methoxy-5-(2-ethylhexyloxy)-1,4-phenylenevinylene] - a fullerene derivative used as an electron acceptor in the PSCs.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. ITO: Indium Tin Oxide - a conductive material with a resistance value of approximately 10-15 Ω sq.-1.
2. PEDOT: PSS: A conducting polymer with a conductivity value of around 10-3 S/cm.
3. LiF: Lithium Fluoride - a compound with a melting point of 802 °C and a boiling point of 1463 °C.
4. Al: Aluminum - a metal with a melting point of 660.32 °C and a boiling point of 2519 °C.
5. PC71BM (or PC61BM): A fullerene derivative with a molecular weight of approximately 1021 g/mol and a glass transition temperature of around -30 °C.

Note: The resistance value for ITO and conductivity value for PEDOT:PSS are approximate values and can vary depending on the specific fabrication conditions and material batches.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Indium Tin Oxide - a conductive material with a resistance value of approximately 10-15 Ω sq.-1. |
| Poly(3,4-ethylenedioxythiophene): Poly(styrenesulfonate) - a conducting polymer with a conductivity value of around 10-3 S/cm. |
| Lithium Fluoride - a compound with a melting point of 802 °C and a boiling point of 1463 °C. |
| Aluminum - a metal with a melting point of 660.32 °C and a boiling point of 2519 °C. |
| Poly[2-methoxy-5-(2-ethylhexyloxy)-1,4-phenylenevinylene] - a fullerene derivative with a molecular weight of approximately 1021 g/mol and a glass transition temperature of around -30 °C. |
